newsitem.title: CHINA: China Oct consumer goods sales seen up 18.6 pct.
newsitem.headline: China Oct consumer goods sales seen up 18.6 pct.

text.p: China's retail sales of consumer goods are expected to climb 18.6 percent to 216 billion yuan ($26 billion) in October from a year ago, the China Securities newspaper said on Monday.

Retail sales of consumer goods were 208.35 billion yuan in September, an increase of 18.3 percent from the year-earlier month, the newspaper said, quoting a report by the Information Centre under the cabinet's State Economic and Trade Commission.
Sales of consumer goods in the third quarter of 1996 rose a year-on-year 17.4 percent to 588.9 billion yuan, it said.

Reform of the housing sector and a boost in rural incomes from the autumn harvest had helped fuel the rise in the retail sales market, the newspaper quoted analysts as saying. It gave no further details.
